revised_title: On the Epipolic Dispersion of Light: A Supplement to a Paper on Superficial Color in Homogeneous Liquids
tldr: The author, John Frederick William Herschel, investigates the unique colored dispersion of white light when it passes through a solution of sulfate of quinine. He explores the laws governing this phenomenon, which he calls "epipolic dispersion," and examines other substances that exhibit similar properties. He also discovers that an epipolical beam of light cannot undergo further dispersion.
